intro: Hieracium peltifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are broadly ovate and often have a hairy texture. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium peltifolium is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
